definition: to recover (sth lost or stolen)/to get back
to sculpt/to carve/musical instrument (old)
to chase after/to seek/to do one's utmost to seek or procure sth/to recall
to curve/to return/to revolve
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
variant of 迴|回[hui2]

sentences.english: And the king took off his ring, which he had taken from Haman, and gave it unto Mordecai.
sentences.chinese: 王摘下自己的戒指，就是从哈曼追回的，给了末底改。

sentences.english: Nowadays, 99 cent compositions are all the rage. Well, it’s time to bring the good old days back.
sentences.chinese: 那么，现在是时候把过去的好时光追回来了。

sentences.english: But we can claw it back.
The multimode made up her mind DanSi LAN, and request back KongZhu help.
sentences.chinese: 亚多模下定决计追回丹丝兰，并请求孔珠帮助。

sentences.english: Tracking your past-due accounts and actively pursuing collections.
sentences.chinese: 追踪你的逾期未付的款项，积极的追回这些货款。

sentences.english: Big brother advised Guo tiger to recover orchid.
You can try to get her back.
sentences.chinese: 你可以试着把她追回来。

sentences.english: Nothing in the future, will correct thoses moments that you have missed in the past.
sentences.chinese: 在流逝的岁月里错过的时刻，永远无法追回。

sentences.english: The owner is entitled to recover stolen property even if you have purchased the goods "in good faith."
sentences.chinese: 物主有权追回该项贼赃，即使你已经购买了该项货物。

sentences.english: But we are charged up , we want to make some points and recover.
sentences.chinese: 但是我们要面对挑战，尽快的把分数追回来。

sentences.english: No money has power to bring that back to life.
The precautions and inspections of capital transfer are the base to retrieve the corruptive capitals.
sentences.chinese: 预防和监测资产转移是追回腐败资产的基础。

sentences.english: I had to chase my dog after he escaped.
sentences.chinese: 我的狗跑了，我得把它追回来才行。

definition: to recover (stolen property)/to pursue and force sb to give back the spoils
to return sth/to revert
booty/stolen goods
to retrieve/to redeem
to retrieve
to order the return of stolen goods
restitution/return of something to its original owner/remittance
to demand payment of money owing
booty/stolen property
property/belongings
to return sth/to hand back
funds/a sum of money/CL:宗[zong1]
to return something to its rightful owner
(of a bird, fish etc) to be caught in a net/(of a tennis ball) to hit the net/(of a criminal) to be captured
to bring to justice/to file away (a document)
to lose by theft/to have one's property stolen
